body_html:
@vrv @aleist mentioned he's using the devel-gpu docker image. For the devel-* images,the pip package is built and installed during Docker build, instead of downloaded and installed from a centralized location, as in the non-devel images.

C.f.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu#L97
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.gpu#L45
body_text:
@vrv @aleist mentioned he's using the devel-gpu docker image. For the devel-* images,the pip package is built and installed during Docker build, instead of downloaded and installed from a centralized location, as in the non-devel images.
C.f.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu#L97
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.gpu#L45
body:
@vrv @aleist mentioned he's using the `devel-gpu` docker image. For the `devel-*` images,the pip package is built and installed during Docker build, instead of downloaded and installed from a centralized location, as in the non-devel images. 

C.f.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu#L97
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.gpu#L45
